column5: first off a belated Merry Christmas and Happy New Year to everyone  havne't been around to much lately as i've been working like a madman thru the month of december but i'm now back to my regular shifts and actually have days off  to relax  finally figured out how to post pics that aren't thumbnails  yesterday was my first chance to do some ice fishing and being that i'm don't trust ice all that much i figured i'd go a little north for some trout, drove to a small lake in the gogama area and was supposed to meet my brother and his bud on the lake at sun up, being his drive was much shorter than mine he should have been there before me, but nope, got left home around 6:15 hit the bait shop for 2 doz. chubs (8 bucks) OUCH    then timmies for a coffee and a few timbits and off i went got to the lake just past 8:00 after a beautiful morning drive with the full moon setting down daylight breaking  with my brother nowhere to be seen i gave him a call on the cell for him to tell me he had just left  so out i went by myself and they never got there till 10:00, there was about 6-8" of ice with an inch or two of slush and another inch or two of snow   here's the tranquility of the lake just after i set up (not a single ripple on the water)    here's my first    we caught 8 specks and 1 splake in total, missed quite a few at the hole and lots of nippers  here's our loot at the end of the day   finally here's the moon coming up at the end of the day   all in all a great day and glad to finally get out there

There is an awfully long list of fishing things I have yet to experience, that I want to do someday. Catching squaretails through the ice is way up there on that list.  Thanxs for sharing, and I'm glad you had a good day on the ice.
Awesome, and keep that ice wherever it is, because I dont want it! Theres more steelheading to be done!
Nice trout, sounds like a beautiful winter day...  But you can keep the ice as far as I'm concerned...  Mike
Nicely done. I can't wait for the hardwater down this way. Thanks
OOOOOOH YA!!! nice stuff, great pic's, thx...
You are one of the 1st to post ice fishing pictures. Those Trout look like they will be good table fare!
Finally hard water .....  for someone anyway.  I'll bet they were tasty after being out day.  Nice pics !
That's beaaaaaaaaaaaaaaautiful!  Perfect day too.  Now i'm all excited  Thanks,
Nice catch!Man I am missing the ice!Keep the reports coming.
great pics & report,love those specs,must have been nice to get out on the ice WTG
One word bud ... Speck-tac-ular !!!!!   Any time you're looking for some company PM me ... I'll travel many many miles for specks like that !
Nice! Those specs are sure fun through the ice..Great report.  -Andrew
Excellent job on the trout.  Thanks for sharing.  Enjoy your meal.
